channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Councils miss deadline for identifying quake-prone buildings
item.description: Two councils have missed a key deadline for identifying earthquake-prone buildings.

item.title: Covid-19 update: Two new cases reported in New Zealand today
item.description: There were two new cases of Covid-19 reported in managed isolation today, while the Health Ministry says it has spoken to a woman who tested positive after travelling from NZ to Australia.

item.title: Modern slavery rife in NZ and Pacific Islands, charity claims
item.description: One in 150 people are living in "modern slavery" in New Zealand, Australia and the Pacific Islands, according to a new report by a human rights charity.

item.title: Trial ferry service from Pukete to central Hamilton set to begin
item.description: Hamilton residents will soon have a new way to get to work - up the Waikato River.

item.title: Rocket launch planned from Hawke's Bay, after failed mission
item.description: Rocket Lab has been given the green light for an Electron rocket launch from Hawke's Bay, after its last mission failed.

item.title: Stranded boaties in 'dire' situation appeal for New Zealand's help
item.description: Hundreds of boaties stranded in the Pacific are making a humanitarian appeal to be allowed safe refuge in New Zealand from the dangerous cyclone season.

item.title: Two people die in separate motorbike crashes in Bay of Plenty
item.description: Two people have died in separate motorbike crashes in the Bay of Plenty in less than 24 hours.

item.title: Yellow-eyed penguin plan aims to halt slide towards extinction
item.description: An action plan to try to stop the endangered hoiho/ yellow-eyed penguin from becoming extinct has been released today.

item.title: Man jailed for incest freed on parole after admitting fault
item.description: An Oamaru man who got his daughter pregnant has been granted parole after saying he no longer blamed her for their sexual relationship.

item.title: More New Zealanders get flu shots in wake of pandemic
item.description: More than half of Māori aged 65 and over have been vaccinated against the flu, after a government push.

item.title: New spa on Rotorua lakefront gets government funding
item.description: Plans for a new hot springs spa in Rotorua are going ahead, with a $38 million grant from the Provincial Growth Fund.

item.title: Call for NZ Defence Force to apologise to villages where civilians were killed
item.description: The New Zealand Defence Force is being urged to apologise to the villages in Afghanistan where it killed civilians in 2010.

item.title: Tests to check for Covid-19 community transmission underway
item.description: Targeted Covid-19 testing will take place in South Auckland, Christchurch and Queenstown today and tomorrow, to check there is no community transmission.

item.title: Huge rush expected after Milford, Routeburn Tracks repaired
item.description: Two Fiordland Great Walks that were severely damaged by flooding and landslips will fully reopen this summer.

item.title: Concerns Covid-19 patients could hide contact details out of 'shame'
item.description: There are concerns Covid patients may not always tell the truth about who they've been in contact with and public health staff say it could be due to shame/bullying.

item.title: Woman urges others to get tested for 'silent killer' Hepatitis C
item.description: A woman who had been living with Hepatitis C without knowing is urging others to get checked.

item.title: Covid-19 brings home the bacon for food banks
item.description: The gruesome prospect of mass slaughters of pigs on farms because of over-supply prompted the government to buy 12,000 carcasses during lockdown - and donate them to food banks.

item.title: Avalanche team protects people from invisible road hazard
item.description: Each winter, a small team of specialist avalanche forecasters begin their vigil to keep people safe while travelling on the Milford Road.
